activities:
Jeppesen collects, processes, and stores personal information for the following purposes:
Employee Data
•	Design, evaluate, and implement HR programs and services to fulfill the employment agreement, which include but are not limited to staffing, compensation, education, employee development, training, relocation, employee relations,  and organizational development, and payroll.
•	Support employee performance and development assessment programs.
•	Fulfill legal, contractual, and compliance related commitments, such as subpoenas, garnishments, ethics investigations, disciplinary investigations, and security investigations, and compliance with lawful requests for information from government agencies.
•	Supply our external providers and partners HR data so they can administer programs such as health & welfare, savings plan, pension, stock options and insurance, stock incentives, stock awards, life insurance, employment verification, unions, and bank direct deposits.
•	Supply other internal service providers such as legal, medical, security, corporate electronic directory, information systems management, etc. with HR data so they can manage their processes and programs.
Customer Data
•	To support the Order Entry process and feed all order fulfillment, distribution and financial processes stemming from customer orders
•	To understand demographic trends
•	For customer service
•	For product and service marketing and promotion
•	To facilitate customer use of Jeppesen web sites
•	To provide customers with information, products and services they request
•	To inform customers about other information, events, promotions, products or services that might be of interest to them
•	To administer and assist Jeppesen with the operation of web sites and of its business.
•	For the purpose for which the information was provided.
eucountries: Denmark, Estonia, France, Germany, Greece, Italy, Norway, Poland, Sweden, United Kingdom
privacyprograms: Jeppesen adheres to corporate policies governing the privacy and security of HR and customer data; complies with the PCI data security standard; is a member of the National Association of Credit Management (NACM) – USA and Institute of Credit Management (ICM) – UK; and complies with NACM published Ethics of Credit.
recoursemech: Jeppesen attempts to resolve complaints internally; however, if complaints cannot be resolved internally, Jeppesen will refer the complainant to the EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) for employee data, or to the American Arbitration Association (AAA) for customer data.
